meta: Redirect Rule allows you to redirect pattern based URLs to another URL. Can be used to redirect assets (JS/CSS/API end points) from production to staging/qa/dev environment, set up URL Shortcuts. Supports wildcard and regex based Url matching. Available on Chrome, Firefox & Edge. Reqeustly desktop app can be used on Safari & other desktop apps.
description: Redirect a request URL (or matching pattern) to another URL.

features.featureContent: Easily redirect your app from production to local environment in a few easy clicks!
Switching between several different API endpoints is extremely simple with Requestly.
With Requestly, you get our very own Mock Server Integration out of the box with the Redirect Request Rule. No need to a separate localhost server when the work can be easier!

features.featureName: Debug your Tag on External Sites
features.featureContent: Easily debug & switch between production & dev version of your tag on external sites. More reliable & convenient than Tealium, Adobe Launch, Search Discovery Switch...
With Requestly, you can easily set a URL to always redirect to something you should actually spend time on. No distractions.

testimonials.name: Carpii UK
testimonials.content: Great extension, very powerful once you learn how to use it. Having tried lots of extensions there's nothing which even comes close (flexible rules and hooks, regexp support, inject javascript etc). Support is excellent, and devs are very responsive. I use Requestly for quite a few different things now, including redirecting local domains to development so I don't have to mess about managing endless dns entries.Very happy with extension especially once you use Premium.

testimonials.name: Mike Alcock
testimonials.content: It's the best redirect tool by far, offering much functionality and flexibility above the alternatives. If you use it a lot and could make use of a large number of rules, I'd say it's well worth buying a licence.

testimonials.name: Zac Gorowski
testimonials.content: I love this extension! You can redirect/replace small sections of links, which is exactly what I needed. I use it to redirect things like normal Amazon links to the 'smile.amazon' version.

testimonials.name: Justin L
testimonials.content: I'm a web dev and thus needed to be able to redirect script calls when in development mode using vue. Had it up and running in seconds. This saved me tonnes of time. Great plugin.

meta: Modify Headers and HTTP(s) Requests in a single click using Requestly. Add, Delete or Replace HTTP(s) Request & Response Headers
description: Add, Delete, Replace Request & Response Headers.
additionalContext: Can be used to remove X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, CORS Issues, etc.
briefContent: HTTP(s) headers are key-value pairs which are used by the client or the server to provide supplementary data along with a HTTP(s) request or response. Our tool, being the best in the game, allows you to modify headers of traffic on your favourite browser. This tool allows you to delete headers to stop online tracking, test your site in production and also remove Content-Security-Policy while testing and so much more

examples.title: Prevent browser downloading images
examples.description: When a web server sends an unknown MimeType to browsers, browsers automatically download the files as they are unable to understand how to parse and render the response

examples.title: Open a website in an iframe
examples.description: Often companies add a header to their website so that the browser will refuse to open the page within an i-frame. But using Requestly, you can implement a work-around.

moreInfo.title: Application and use cases
moreInfo.description: Here's how you can use Requestly's Modify Headers feature in your daily workflow...

features.featureContent: You can add, modify and even remove headers from the URL provided. Modify headers like User-Agent, Access-Control-Allow-Origin, etc.
Configure the criteria of URL on which the rules applies. Options like if the URL contains, equals or matches regex.
Freemium users can pair upto 3 rules and premium users can pair unlimited rules together to match any preferred use case.

testimonials.name: Andrew Thompson
testimonials.content: #Requestly #Debug & #Modify #network requests - loved by 100K+ #webdevs If you are a #webdeveloper, Requestly is for you. You can set up #URL #redirects, #rewrites, run custom JS, modify headers, etc. https://requestly.in/?ref=producthunt #requestly #producthunt

description: Allows you to automate, scrape & change webpage's behaviour with little knowledge of JS & CSS.

moreInfo.title: Application and use cases

features.featureContent: You can use Requestly to inject custom JS on your specified URL. The possibilities for testing and modifications are endless with Requestly!
You can let Requestly inject custom CSS on your specified URL, letting you test and verify your styles.
You can directly insert the installation code that you get for integration from the 3rd party app and try it on your website.

meta: Generate custom API response. Host your HTML/CSS/JS/Other files on our server and test it using a custom URL.
description: Edit Content-Type, Status Code, and Body of the Response on our Server.
additionalContext: Edit and Delete Mock API Responses without building an API. Add/Remove Headers as well
briefContent: Using our Mock Server we enable the user to generate custom API responses without actually having a pre-built API or a backend server. We also allow the user to upload HTML/CSS/JS files on our server and see it live in action using the URL generated without actually hosting the project.

moreInfo.title: Application and use cases
moreInfo.description: Here's how you can use Requestly's Mock Server feature in your daily workflow...

features.featureContent: When the backend isn't ready and you want to mock the API response.
Beside from mocking an API Response, we also allow you to write plain HTML/CSS/JS on our editor and test it out without the hassle of deploying.
You can edit or delete the Mock. The mock allows you to edit Content-Type, Status Code and body of the response. Also enables you to Add/Remove Headers

meta: Selenium is widely used as a test automation framework for end-to-end testing of web applications. However, it can't intercept and modify network requests. But now you can simulate network conditions, modify headers, redirect network requests - all these and much more with the help of our Selenium package.
description: Selenium is widely used as a test automation framework for end-to-end testing of web applications. However, it can't intercept and modify network requests.
descriptionOnCard: Use Requestly rules in Selenium. Modify Headers, Set up Redirects, Block Requests etc in Selenium.
additionalContext: But now you can simulate network conditions, modify headers, redirect network requests - all these and much more with the help of our Selenium package.
briefContent: Add Network Interception & Modification powers to Selenium without code. Set up Redirects, Modify Headers, Insert Custom Scripts, Add Throttles and much more to Selenium using Requestly.

examples.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing
examples.description: Modify headers - bypass authentication, set cookies and more with Requestly's npm package for Selenium.

examples.title: Automate Network Testing via Selenium
examples.description: Ever wondered how you can control network condition for specific requests in your testing environment ? Look no further, we've got you covered. Learn more in the article.

meta: Share all your rules from a central place. Auto import rules periodically from a remote server.
description: Share all your rules from a central place. Auto import rules periodically from a remote server.
descriptionOnCard: Share all your rules from a central place. Auto import rules periodically from a remote server.
briefContent: Remote rules by Requestly offers you control over sharing your rules from a central server. Just share the server url once and we would ensure that the rules in the server would get auto imported periodically. How frequent the rules get auto imported or auto updated can be controlled by the end user.

meta: Session recorder allows you to record activity on a webpage and capture details like console logs and network requests stitched together.
description: Allows you to record activity on a webpage and capture details like console logs and network requests stitched together.
additionalContext: A recorded session can be shared with others for offline review or debugging purposes.
briefContent: Browse like a normal user, record and share the bug with your team.

moreInfo.title: Features
moreInfo.description: Here's how you can use Requestly's session recording feature in your daily workflow...

features.featureContent: Using the Session Recording feature, you can configure URLs of the web pages on which you want to keep a watch.
Automatically records while browsing.
Whenever you notice something weird, ask Requestly to generate a recording of the current session along with console logs and network requests details.
Share the recording link with your developers to ease the bug reporting process and they can access all details of the session required for the investigation.
